msContents.summary: Originally, the entire juz' 22 was bound and given as a waqf, but as the manuscript now stands, it is only Surah 33:31-71; 34:16-23, 41-47; 35:2-10. (either Kufan or Hijaz system)

msItemStruct.note: Text area measures 13 x 20 cm. Dark reddish-brown leather covers board made of layers of old manuscripts. The inside is lined with thin dark leather with an allover arabesque. The outside shows a gold-tooled central medallion consisting of geometric figures built around a 6 pointed star. The figures form a 12 pointed star inscribed within a circle, outside of which are 12 lobes, 10 of them semi-circular, their outer edges bordered by a twist with "finials." The other 2 lobes, at the top and bottom, are each modified into a pointed arch from the point of which projects a sort of fleur-de-lis. The corner designs harmonize with the outer elements of the central medallion. What may be a much simplified plant motif is used in the rectangular frame of the cover.
Pub. status: Published: recto and verso

condition.ab: As in O.I. 12033, only the front cover and part of the back strip are left of the binding, which is however still attached to some of the manuscript folios.

layout.ab: 21 folios with 5 lines per page in Arabic
Source of description: On recto and verso: Qur'an

handDesc.p: In all respects, this manuscript is similar to O.I. 12032 a and the two give every indication of being parts of the same Qur'an, though probably of different juz' volumes.
